triples.name: Ising model
triples.relevance: Classical statistical mechanics model that is generalized to the nonreciprocal case.

triples.name: Phase transition
triples.relevance: Framework used to analyze the stability and critical behavior of nonreciprocal phases.

triples.name: Mean-field theory
triples.relevance: Analytical approach used to predict homogeneous phases and their properties.

triples.name: Critical exponent
triples.relevance: Characterizes the power-law behavior near phase transitions, shown to change from Ising to XY class.

triples.name: Classical XY model
triples.relevance: Universality class that the nonreciprocal Ising model transitions to in three dimensions.

triples.name: Symmetry breaking
triples.relevance: Mechanism that stabilizes static order by breaking symmetry between spin types.

triples.name: Active matter
triples.relevance: Application domain where nonreciprocal phases and globally ordered oscillations are observed.

triples.name: Spontaneous symmetry breaking
triples.relevance: Novel mechanism discovered where breaking symmetry between spin types stabilizes the ordered phase in nonreciprocal systems.
